info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Pike County through 445 PM EDT... At 430 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Greeley, or 11 miles west of Montague, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Shohola, Greeley, Twin Lakes and Lords Valley. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 84 near 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for northeastern Pennsylvania.
